headline: Co-founder & COO at Avion School (YC W21)
summary: Bridging the gap between untapped talent in Southeast Asia and software engineering opportunities in Silicon Valley.

experiences.title: Product
experiences.description:
The Philippine Digital Asset Exchange (PDAX) is a centralized order-book exchange enabling Filipinos to buy and sell digital assets directly with Philippine Peso (PHP).

My time in PDAX was focused on helping build, test, and launch the exchange. I held positions from research, to design, then spent the last run of my stint there in growth.

experiences.title: Product Design
experiences.description:
Partnered with Product Design Lead & Business Development Manager to oversee 2-month long open beta testing, tracking user flows, discovering bottlenecks, and documenting consistent user behavior--all of which led to strategic decisions in designing our exchange.

• Designed initial wireframes for an updated version of our landing page based on beta-user feedback and internal testing (https://pdax.ph/)
• Analyzed existing information architecture to propose a new content flow of administrative tools.
• Applied initial user feedback on a proposed design for sign up and KYC flows to reduce drop-off points.
• Conducted usability tests with 10 closed-beta users and drafted a report including impeding user flows, corresponding design solutions, and feature requests. (Our final study indicated that the product was ready for launch and will be met positively by our target market)
• Tools Used: Hotjar, Adobe XD

experiences.title: UX Research
experiences.description:
• Conducted and managed mass user research survey/email marketing campaigns to over 6000+ users.
• Performed a/b tests on email marketing study using click-through rate (CTR), open rate, and intentional design choices as testing variables.
• Increased open-beta applications by 40% in over two months by proposing new email templates.
• Created manuals that informed internals of current user personas and market segments for the main exchange.
• Tools Used: Drip, Adobe XD.

experiences.title: Product
experiences.description:
MedGrocer's ePharmacy eliminates the inefficient processes brought upon the traditional infrastructure of drugstores through its digital platform. Customers can order online and have their medicine delivered to their doorstep.

Alongside MedGrocer's online pharmacy is its corporate health services which enable BPOs to optimize medicine expenses, reduce administrative burden, and generate data-driven decisions moving forward.

• Worked with Product Manager to initiate the latest growth strategy of entering clinic management services.
• Researched legal compliance (DOLE, OSH Standards), and acquired permits for market expansion.
• Designed corporate medicine benefit programs (i.e proactive nursing treatment, quarterly checkups, lifestyle management interventions) aimed to reduce BPOs most prominent illnesses and HMO costs.
• Launched partnership with local NGO Red Ribbon to partake in distributing HIV test kits to communities in need of assistance.
• Contributed medical research to the internal repository for diseases that serve as the backbone for designing corporate interventions.

education.degree_name: Bachelor of Science in Management Information Systems

accomplishment_honors_awards.title: National Champion & Best Speaker for Entrepreneurship, National Youth Business Conference (NYBC) 2018: Entrepreneur Case Competition
accomplishment_honors_awards.description:
· Ranked 1st place out of 10 teams from around the Philippines.
· Pitched "Bibli," a B2C E-Commerce marketplace for retail bookstores to partners from Launchgarage.

accomplishment_honors_awards.title: Philippines Representative & People's Choice Award, University of Technology Sydney (UTS): International Technology Innovation Competition 2017 (Kuala Lumpur)
accomplishment_honors_awards.description:
· Placed in the final 3 out of 100+ teams in South East Asia.
· Pitched "N-Light," a Li-Fi integrated smart city that impacts communication, education, and privacy.
· Flown to Kuala Lumpur to give a 15-minute presentation on smart cities in front of a panel of international judges.

Read more here: https://lifestyle.inquirer.net/265232/xavier-school-students-bag-double-awards-intl-technology-innovation-tilt/?utm_expid=.XqNwTug2W6nwDVUSgFJXed.1
